{{Icelandic name|Hugleikur|male}} {{Infobox comics creator | image = Hugleikur Dagsson.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Hugleikur Dagsson at the Turku Book Fair 2009 | birth_name = Þórarinn Hugleikur Dagsson | birth_date = {{b-da|5 October 1977}} | birth_place = [[Akureyri]], Iceland | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = Icelandic | area = [[Cartoonist]], playwright, film critic | alias = | notable works = | awards = }} '''Þórarinn Hugleikur Dagsson''' ({{IPA-is|huɣˈleiːkʰœr.̍daɣsɔːn}}), nicknamed '''Hulli''', born 5 October 1977 is an [[Iceland]]ic artist. He received a B.A. degree from the [[Iceland Academy of the Arts]] in 2002.<ref name="harpercollins">[http://www.harpercollins.com/authors/32425/Hugleikur_Dagsson/index.aspx Hugleikur Dagsson from HarperCollins Publishers<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name="forlagid">{{cite web|url=http://www.forlagid.is/?p=6749|title=Hugleikur Dagsson « Forlagið – vefverslun|publisher=forlagid.is|accessdate=2016-05-20|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160605025015/http://www.forlagid.is/?p=6749|archivedate=2016-06-05|df=}}</ref>
He was a [[film critic]] in a popular [[Iceland]]ic [[radio]] program on [[Radíó X]] and hosted another program called ''Hugleikur'' on the same station. ''Hugleikur'' is known for all kinds of visual and video art. He is most famous for his [[satire|satirical]] comics filled with black humor, which have been published as books and in [[The Reykjavik Grapevine|The Reykjavik Grapevine Magazine]].
Hugleikur has written three [[stage plays]]. The first ''Forðist okkur'' (Avoid us), is based on one of his books. It is a story about three [[dysfunctional families]]. The second, ''Leg'' (Uterus), is a musical about teenage pregnancy in the near future of Iceland. "Baðstofan" (Living Room) his third play, is a dark vision of Iceland in the 18th century. All plays received rave reviews and Hugleikur received "the playwright of the year" award for ''Forðist okkur''.<ref name="harpercollins"/>
In 2006 [[Penguin Books]] published ''Should You Be Laughing at This?'', which is a collection of cartoons previously published as ''Forðist okkur'' (Avoid us) by [[JPV books]] in Iceland. ''Is This Supposed to be Funny?'', the second cartoon book, was published by [[Penguin Books]] in October 2007. Third book, ''Is This Some Kind of joke?'', was published in 2008.
